title: Quizzer AI
description: An quiz app that dynamically generates quizzes using Gemini API with personalized questions, instant feedback & explanations for mistakes.
longDescription:
Quizzer AI revolutionizes technical interview prep by ditching static question banks. It uses the Gemini 2.0 Flash Lite engine to generate unique questions on the fly based on user prompts. 

Beyond generation, it acts as a tutor: if you get a question wrong, the system analyzes your specific logic error and explains *why* the answer was incorrect, rather than just showing the right option. It features a distraction-free 'Midnight' UI, split-screen code analysis, and persistent history tracking.
features: HTMX-powered SPA feel without page reloads
installation:
git clone https://github.com/qtremors/quizzer-ai
pip install -r requirements.txt
python manage.py migrate
python manage.py runserver

title: GitNexus
description: A powerful, self-hosted web application for monitoring repository updates, managing local downloads, and exploring GitHub profiles.
longDescription:
GitNexus bridges the gap between GitHub and your local machine. It allows you to track specific repositories for updates, visualize commit history, and deeply explore user profiles.

Its standout feature is the Server-Side Downloader, which bypasses browser API limits to download multiple assets or source codes directly to your local file system in a structured format.
installation:
git clone https://github.com/qtremors/git-nexus.git
cd git-nexus
uv sync
uv run app.py

title: Algorithm Visualizer
description: A full-stack app that visualizes algorithms in real time. React (TypeScript) on the front, FastAPI on the back — letting users see each algorithm’s steps as they happen.
longDescription:
Unlike standard visualizers that pre-calculate steps, AlgoVisualizer runs the actual algorithm on the Python backend and streams the state frame-by-frame to the React frontend via WebSockets.

It supports Sorting (Bubble, Insertion, Selection) and Pathfinding (Dijkstra, BFS, DFS) with features like wall drawing, VCR-style playback controls, and adjustable execution speed.
installation:
# Clone and setup
cd backend && pip install -r requirements.txt
cd frontend && npm install

# Run
uvicorn main:app --reload
npm run dev

title: Tremors Music Player
description: A high-performance, local-first desktop music player with a Python backend and a modern React UI — lightning-fast library scanning, smart metadata, lyrics sync, and a premium Apple-Music-style design.
longDescription:
Built for audiophiles who prefer local libraries over cloud streaming. Tremors Music combines a Python FastAPI backend for high-speed file system access and metadata parsing with a modern React UI.

It handles libraries of 5,000+ songs effortlessly using virtualization, fetches synchronized lyrics automatically, and extracts technical audio specs (Bitrate, Sample Rate) in real-time.
features: Real-time ID3 Tag & Cover Art Extraction
Glassmorphism UI with Dynamic Accent Colors
installation:
git clone https://github.com/qtremors/tremors-music.git
cd tremors-music

# Install Backend
cd backend
uv sync
cd ..

# Install Frontend
cd frontend
npm install
cd ..

# Run Backend
cd backend
uv run uvicorn main:app --reload

# Run Frontend
cd frontend
npm run dev

title: Plant Disease Detector
description: A Django and TensorFlow web app that classifies plant diseases from leaf images, allowing users to upload an image and get health predictions.
longDescription:
A Proof of Concept (PoC) demonstrating the integration of TensorFlow into a Django web app. It uses Transfer Learning on a MobileNetV2 model to classify apple leaves into categories like Apple Scab, Black Rot, and Cedar Apple Rust.

The app features confidence scoring, interactive probability charts using Plotly.js, and a history database of past scans.
installation:
git clone https://github.com/qtremors/plant-disease-detector.git
cd plant-disease-detector
uv sync
uv run python manage.py migrate
uv run python manage.py runserver

title: E-commerce Website
description: A fully functional e-commerce site built with Python and Django, using the 'EShopper' template and offering a complete storefront.
longDescription:
A full-featured e-commerce platform built on Django. It handles the entire user journey: from browsing categorized products and applying coupons to a multi-step checkout process integrated with Razorpay.

It includes a comprehensive user dashboard for order history, profile management, and password resets via email OTP.
features: Full User Auth flow with Email OTP
installation:
git clone https://github.com/qtremors/eshopper
cd shopping
python -m venv venv
# Activate venv
pip install -r requirements.txt
python manage.py migrate
python manage.py createsuperuser
python manage.py runserver

title: Lines of Code in Repo
description: A Git-aware CLI that counts lines of code in your repo instantly. No dependencies(just python), no configuration needed.
longDescription:
Locr is a blazing fast, dependency-free utility designed to count lines of code in Git repositories. Born out of frustration with slow file scanners, it uses a 'Hybrid Eager Pruning' strategy to instantly skip massive junk folders (like node_modules) before even querying Git.

Unlike simple counters, it respects your .gitignore rules perfectly, supports language-specific syntax highlighting in the terminal, and handles graceful interrupts so you can stop a massive scan and still get partial results.
installation:
# Clone or download this repo, then navigate to it
git clone https://github.com/qtremors/locr.git
cd locr

# Install in editable mode
pip install -e .

title: PC Remote Control API
description: A Python + FastAPI tool that lets you control your PC from your phone — media playback, system power, screenshots, and app launching over a clean local web interface.
longDescription:
This tool turns your smartphone into a remote control for your PC. It runs a lightweight FastAPI server that listens for commands from a mobile-friendly web interface.

You can control system volume, media playback (Spotify/YouTube), take screenshots that appear on your phone, and perform system power actions like Sleep or Lock.
installation:
git clone https://github.com/qtremors/pc-rc
cd pc-rc
uv venv
# Activate venv (Windows: .venv\Scripts\activate, Linux: source .venv/bin/activate)
uv pip install -r requirements.txt
# Create .env with HOST=0.0.0.0 PORT=8000
python main.py

title: RepoTree Generator
description: A Git-aware CLI that generates clean directory trees, filtering files using .gitignore so only real source code shows up — no build junk, no clutter.
longDescription:
RepoTree solves the problem of 'dirty' directory dumps. It automatically parses .gitignore files to hide build artifacts and caches, ensuring your diagram only shows relevant source code.

It supports multiple visualization modes (ASCII tree, Flat list), depth limiting for high-level overviews, and can output directly to files without ANSI color codes.
installation:
# Clone the repository
git clone https://github.com/qtremors/file-tree-generator.git

# Navigate to the project folder
cd file-tree-generator

# Install the CLI in editable mode
pip install -e .

title: Local Team Chat
description: A self-hosted, real-time messaging platform for local LAN networks, featuring DMs and Group chats.
longDescription:
Designed for small offices requiring privacy, this app runs entirely on a local host machine. It utilizes WebSockets for instant messaging and manages state via a unified 'Room' architecture where Direct Messages are simply rooms with two members.

The frontend is responsive, adapting from a dual-pane desktop view to a mobile-app-like interface on smaller screens.
installation:
# Backend
cd backend
uv venv
# Activate venv
uv sync
uvicorn app.main:app --host 0.0.0.0 --port 8000 --reload

# Frontend
cd frontend
npm install
# Set VITE_API_HOST in .env.local
npm run dev

title: Calculator App (PYgame)
description: A fully functional calculator implemented as a single Python script using Pygame with a responsive GUI and persistent history.
longDescription:
A demonstration of building functional GUI applications using game libraries. This calculator features a scrollable history log that persists between sessions, dynamic font scaling for long numbers, and full keyboard support.

It handles standard arithmetic as well as scientific operations like percentage and sign toggling.

title: Earnslate Finance
description: A modern PWA for personal finance tracking with budget management, analytics, and subscription monitoring.
longDescription:
Earnslate is a Progressive Web App (PWA) built with the T3 stack philosophy. It allows users to track income, expenses, and recurring subscriptions.

It features comprehensive data visualization using Recharts to show spending trends, a budgeting system with rollover logic, and robust authentication via Better Auth. The interface is built with Shadcn/UI for a clean, accessible experience.
installation:
npx prisma migrate dev
npm run dev

title: Nexus
description: A creative landing page designed to navigate through my digital universe by deploying a fleet of spaceships from the space station.
longDescription:
Nexus is a creative portfolio gateway designed to look like a space station interface. It features a multi-layered background with a starfield that reacts to mouse movement, a central black hole video loop, and complex entrance/exit animations for project cards.

Built with Next.js and tsParticles, it demonstrates advanced frontend animation techniques and component-scoped styling.
installation:
git clone https://github.com/qtremors/nexus.git
cd nexus
npm install
npm run dev

title: The Scrapyard
description: A 3D scroll-based archive for abandoned project ideas, visualizing them as scattered notes.
longDescription:
A unique conceptual website that serves as a final resting place for abandoned code. It uses CSS 3D transforms to create a parallax scrolling effect where project cards float like scattered papers.

The site is automated via GitHub Actions, which scans the repo for project folders and auto-generates the HTML cards during deployment.
